body_content.explanation: a national park (= a large area of land protected by the government because of its natural beauty or because it has a special history) in the US state of California:
examples: Pinnacles National Park has more than 30 miles of trails that showcase the beauty of the park up close and personal.
Some 23 million years ago multiple volcanoes erupted, flowed, and slid to form what would become Pinnacles National Park.
